channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken surface by weeds causing a trip hazard / future degradation of the pavement, 1st July
item.description:
Outside 24, TENSING ROAD. Issue has deteriorated over approx 10 years. The area is predominantly populated by elderly / OAP residents, many with mobility issues. The broken footpath is causing a hazard to elderly and young children pedestrians

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Tensing Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sign has been hit, 1st July
item.description:
On Bourton road turning to Syreford. Just up from Andoversford/A40 traffic lights.By old telephone exchange.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A436, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign structurally damaged/leaning more than 20 degrees/loose in ground (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Another large pothole, 1st July
item.description:
Another large pothole opened up down the hill at the end of Cold Slad Lane towards Journeys End. Lane is getting increasingly bumpy with large potholes all the way down.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of tree replacement causing infrastructural damage, 1st July
item.description:
After logging an emergency call with Cheltenham council this morning it was suggested I reach out to the most appropriate department within the council to find out how we get a council owned tree that was removed last year replaced with a new tree. In May 2024 a large blossom tree was removed on Jersey Avenue (GL522SZ- between property number 5 and 7) which was very disappointing. The tree grew on a grass embankment that we have alongside the road on Jersey avenue. Over the years when trees have been removed they have been replaced by a new council owned tree (which has happened on Jersey Avenue). To date this has not happened. As a result we have seen more cars parking on this grassy embankment and as a result has now dislodged a large manhole cover on the grassy embankment exposing the drain hole. In a scary incident last week our youngest daughter (2 years) jumped on it and nearly feel down the drain hole. This is the emergency that is being addressed by the council as of this morning (ref. 11489410), however we want to also address the cause. Please could we request at the appropriate time of year that the tree is replaced?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Jersey Avenue, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Pothole in the tarmac pavement with visible cavity underneath, 1st July
item.description:
On the left just before Daisybank going up Leckhampton Road there is a hole in the tarmac pavement with a visible cavity underneath. Possibility of a minor collapse of the footpath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
